comments.body: Should we change `flagYesNoAuto` to have the behaviour we need here in a followup PR?

There are two things that are different here:

1. We need to be able to check if the flag was passed or not.
2. We want `true` and `false` to work as well. 

There are quite a few other uses of `flagYesNoAuto` that don‚Äôt need this so for now I would leave it as is. I somewhat wonder if the `flagYesNoAuto` thing is a good idea anyway and we should just switch to `true` `false` and no `auto` everywhere but I‚Äôm not touching that for now.

comments.body: I'm not entirely sure I agree it should get special treatment ‚Äî using the generic syntax removes magic and hints at the existence of other templates ‚Äî but if we do make it special, why not go a bit further? `daml create app` sounds a lot nicer to me.

`daml create app` looks confusing. That sounds like `daml create`  also accepts other parameters. `daml create-app` would be reasonable but I‚Äôm not sure that‚Äôs better given that we refer to it as `create-daml-app` everywhere else.

As for making it a special command `daml create-daml-app foobar` seems sufficiently nicer to me for a GTG than `daml new foobar create-daml-app` that I think it makes sense to have it. (Note that `daml new foobar create-daml-app` still works if you want to use it)
An even nicer-to-have would be `daml create-daml-app` creating a directory called `create-daml-app` by default, to avoid `daml create-daml-app create-daml-app`.
I considered that but I‚Äôm not sure anyone wants to call their project `create-daml-app` so that seems a bit silly.
Sort of a moot point by now, but for clarity I feel compelled to clarify that I meant it as `daml create <new-folder/project-name>`.
Just an idea for the future: using `unwords` instead of `concat` allows for skipping the trailing spaces.
Ah yes, I had done this already in my PR for this same issue, but Moritz's PR was slightly better (and we submitted them at the same time) :-)
